text:
” 影 ”きっと猫猫は” 夜 ”のことを指したいのだろう。 そろそろ日も落ちる。 そして、羅漢が先制攻撃を始める頃だろう。 なぜか羅漢は夜明けではなく、夜更けにかけての戦を狙った。
見にくいだろうに、羅の考えることは本当にわからないことが多い。
「殿下。 以前、” 戦に勝つのが正しいのではない。 戦を起こさないのが正しいのだ。 しかし、正しいことは難しい ”そう仰いましたよね」
「嗚呼、結局、戦は起きてしまったけどな」
trans:
"Shadow" - surely Mao Mao meant to refer to the "night." Dusk was approaching. And soon, Rakan would likely begin his preemptive attack. For some reason, Rakan always aimed for battles in the dead of night, rather than at dawn.
It must be difficult to see, yet there were so many things about Rakan's strategies that remained incomprehensible.
"Your Highness. You once said, 'Winning battles is not about what is right. Preventing them from happening in the first place is what is right. But doing what is right is always difficult.' right?"
"Right, in the end though, the war still broke out."
